document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the Amazonian species of Ropalomera Wiedemann, 1824 (Diptera: Ropalomeridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the Amazonian species of Ropalomera Wiedemann, 1824 (Diptera: Ropalomeridae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype male. Body: 9.9 mm; wing: 9.6 mm

Head: Frons yellow with thin yellowish pilosity and two spots of pale-golden pollinosity between the postocellar bristles and outer vertical bristle; eye circumference with silver pollinosity. Ocellar tubercle dark brown, shiny and with a pair of fine bristles. Postocellar bristles parallel. Postocular bristles present. Antenna with darkbrown scape, very short; pedicel dark brown, twice the size of the scape, with hairs on the anterior margin and with one dorsal short bristle; flagellomere orange basally and dark brown apically; arista plumose with basal third orange and with long, dark-brown hairs. Gena broad, yellow, covered with pale golden pollinosity and slender, dark-brown bristles, which are dorsally short and ventrally longer. Parafacialia dark brown, with black pilosity and three dark-brown, distinct bristles. Face with same color as parafacialia, matte, with globose facial tubercle. Clypeus dark brown. Palpus dark brown with sparse, small, dark setae, and larger setae ventrally.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 15–21.
Ropalomera femorata
3: 15, Sternite 5; 16–17, epandrium (ventral and lateral view); 18, left surstylus (dorsal view); 19, left paramere (lateral outer view); 20–21, inner male terminalia (ventral and lateral view). Scales: 15–17, 20, 21= 0,5mm; 18, 19= 0,2mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Thorax : Scutum brown with acrostichal and dorsocentral stripes of pale-golden pollinosity. Scutellum trapezoid, dorsal surface concave, distal margin rounded, bright and without pollinosity, side of basal half with golden pollinosity. Mesopleuron with stripe of silver pollinosity extending to the anepisternum. Chaetotaxy: one postpronotal, two notopleural, one presutural supra-alar weakly developed, one postsutural supra-alar, one postalar, one intra-alar, one intra-postalar, one acrostichal, and one dorsocentral weakly developed; two short strong scutellar bristles, with one apical and one on lateral half of scutellum. Mesopleuron with one strong bristle on anepisternum, one on katepisternum and one distinct seta on posterior margin of posterior spiracle.

Legs: Coxae with silver pollinosity. Femora dark brown, with slender bristles not longer than the thickness of the femur. Mid and hind femora with golden pollinosity on dorsal surface. Fore femur without pollinosity, and posterior surface without bristles. Mid femur, on basal half, with long thin bristles on ventral surface; distal half with two series of eight spine-like setae that decrease in size toward the apex, one on anteroventral and one on posteroventral surface; posterodorsal surface with two apical setae. Hind femur thicker in the middle region than the other femora, five strong non-aligned bristles on dorsal surface, apical third with two series of five spine-like bristles, one on anteroventral and one on posteroventral surface. Tibiae brown. Fore tibia with slender bristles, distal third with dense golden hairs on anteroventral surface, one dorsal preapical long bristle. Mid tibia with short bristles covering the basal half, with long slender bristles on the apical third of the ventral surface, and with two apical spine-like bristles. Hind tibia with dorsal long, strong bristles, ventral surface of apex with golden pilosity. Tarsi with dense golden hairs on ventral surface; first two tarsomeres yellowish and covered with silver pollinosity.

Female: Differs from the male in the following: shiny facial tubercle, more prominent than in the males; face with two yellow spots below the facial tubercle; legs more slender and with shorter bristles; ovipositor with membranous sternite 7 and sclerotized distal region; oval spermatheca.

Type material.
Holotype male ( ZMUC ) labeled: Colletor Sehestedt & Lund,
Sudamerica
.
Condition of type : good condition, not dissected.

Geographical distribution. Mexico , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Venezuela , Brazil (Roraima, Amapá, Amazonas, Pará, Rondônia, Acre, Mato Grosso, Mato Grosso do Sul, Tocantins, Goiás, Minas Gerais, Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro), Ecuador (Napo), Bolivia , Paraguay and Argentina (Misiones).
Variations. Some specimens have the face and/or parafacialia yellowish, the frons with brown spots on the anterior surface, and the scutum with silver pollinosity stripes.

Discussion. This species was recorded for the first time from Ecuador , in Napo Province. It resembles
Ropalomera albifaciata
in its chaetotaxy, the pattern of spots on the abdomen and wings, the presence of spine-like bristles on sternite 5 , and the number of lobes on the parameres. However, it differs from
R. albifaciata
in the color of the face, which is dark brown in
R. femorata
, the grouped spine-like bristles of sternite 5 , and in the pre-apical spine-like, sclerotized projections on the aedeagus. Other species of the genus either lack this pattern of spines on sternite 5 , and/or have wings with a distinct pattern of spots, or have a pollinose stripe on the mesopleuron extending to the metathoracic spiracle.
